reviews.sentence: Review. Close to downtown. Able to walk to financial district and surrounds. Also accessible by public transportation. Parking was available with in and out privileges. Coffee in room was limited to de caf.

My gatsby Mayfair experience. The hotel fit my theme of the great gatsby even tho the room had no bath and the drawer handles were gone the king size bed was awesome and no bugs. The fridge and mic were awesome and the best part was definately the view. the windows were not clean but it really did not matter it was a great experience I would stay again.

Go any where but here. The only positive thing about my stay was walking in the door for the first time. I was very surprised by the very nice old school layout of the lobby but after that things went downhill fast. My room was completely out dated. The wallpaper was some kind of dirty white canvis that was peeling off the walls the to smelled weird the first thing I did was open the window and turn on the air for ventalation. The bathroom is so ugly and small. When you open the door you have no choice but to open the door fully just to get to the toilet and you can forget about getting to the tub because the door swings in just missing the sink so you have to stand over the toliet close the door and then get in the tub and the reverse must be done to leave the bathroom. The sheets on the bed feel like someone used a gallon of starch on the bed set before making the bed the AC has two setting on at full blast or off lets just say I got very little sleep because I kept getting up adjusting the AC. Last but not least the hotel is doing construction on multiple floors that starts at 8 am forget sleeping in at all. This was such a waist of money. Because of this horrible stay I will not be using hotelscom any more to locate my last minute rooms. For the money I could have stayed at a Super 8 and still had a better room. Such a major disappointment in the hotel the site that has the hotel listed and the mark this hotle left on my birthday.
Fair. Close to the center. The streets around hotel seems to be not quite safe. The room looks old but relatively clean. Shower temperature can not be controlled.
room was pretty small smelled really bad we had a door running to a second room and the only thing locking it was a door lock and we could hear everything could nt even sleep.

Short stay. Hotel is very run down Roms in need of a major upgrade bathroom very small you have to be right inside before you can close the door Area is handy for the subway but I would not like to hang about to long at night.
Conditions of the rooms were fairly poor. staff was friendly and the location is great.

i went for the hockey game. It was close. 4 uber. Small room. I could not fit in the shower. Floor was soaked when I did shower. I was very claustrophobic in the shower and bathroom. The shower is a 2 foot by 2 foot square with a curtain. And the bathroom was about 4 feet wide and 3 feet deep. The area sucks. Heard a car accident outside. And sirens. Not again.

Old hotel going through renovations. This hotel is a dump. Our room was not very clean. The lamp shade between the beds had blood stains on it our bathtub and sink both had mold growing in the corners and neither drained properly. It was almost impossible to have a shower without the tub filling. In the hallway there were crews doing plumbing work welding etc starting at 8 am. This place has tons of potential but we will not be making our way back.

Surprised. Read some reviews and booked based on price and proximity to public transport. Read other reviews after booking and was with trepidation that we arrived. Staff friendly. Room size good bathroom small but adequate. Fridge freezer the largest we have experienced. Loved it. Coffee machine not working properly but was replaced. Public transport great. Laundromat just down the road. Area not the greatest but we were not really concerned about that. Good taco truck at night. Only coffee machine and elevators which of three only one was working.

Will be great when they have finished renovating. When checking in I was advised to pay an extra 20 to get an upgraded room. I was glad I did. The room was on the 15th floor with the most amazing view. The room and bathroom were newly decorated and very comfortable. It is a huge job to upgrade the entire hotel but any building work was unobtrusive and quiet. The old rooms are really not to be recommended.

The hotel is under renovation on the lower floors so I was given a room on the 11th floor. At one point there was only 1 functioning elevator so it did take a few minutes to go up to the room. Despite the construction the room was very quiet and relaxing. The bathroom is a bit cramped but not unmanageable. The shower is shallow and the curtains do not reach the bottom so it can get a little messy but again not unmanageable. The hotel is easily walkable from the LA convention center and very close to many great restaurants. Although it is a few blocks west of Figueroa I did not feel unsafe walking at night. Overall it would be difficult to find a cheaper yet still satisfactory hotel option in downtown LA.

It was comfortable but not perfect. The room decor was nice. It was quiet and clean. The bed was comfortable. The staff were friendly. The valet was fast with my car. The location is across the street from a abandoned graffiti ridden building. Looks a little shady.

A pleasant experience at the Mayfair. The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful and friendly. There was a great view of the city skyline from the windows in the room. Location close to the Metro made getting around the city a breeze. A small microwave oven would have been helpful. The halls were a little too dark. There was adequate lighting but the grey paint absorbed the light.

Nothing special basic. The hotel was in a pretty worn down area and the hotel itself was under construction while we stayed there. It has a lot of potential and I believe the improvements will be great. The rooms were clean and comfy but nothing great.

This is equivalent to a cheap motel stay. Nothing like pictures rooms were filthy. Very disappointed. Unsafe location. The filthy rooms the pictures were a false representation. I would havenever booked had I seen acurate photos.

We were upgraded right off the bat to a king size bed. It was unfortunate that the new lobby was still under construction but it looks like it will be a very beautiful establishment once finished. Room was a good size for us modern decor. No complaints about the room we did n’t realize the room was in a bit of a sketchy part of town. That would be really the only downside.

Great downtown hotel. I had a great stay overnight. I will be back to the Mayfair again. Location staff and room Great location to downtown for walking and public transportation Metro rail DASH bus Ca n’t think of anything.

Renovations are FAR from done but awesome staff. We kept saying that we were just a few weeks too early to really love this hotel. It is being renovated and FAR from near being ready to be the hotel that is advertised by their website. The room was acceptably clean but the comfort ends there. there are currently ZERO AMENITIES on the property. The lobby is only a counter. In spite of the no frills atmosphere right now the staff is GREAT. They are friendly professional and welcoming and they will do an awesome job once the hotel is finished. The hotel lies on the very edge of the financial district of downtown LA and the immediate next block is VERY run down. GET THE VALET PARKING as i would not trust to park my car anywhere else near the hotel at this point.
Wonderful. The lobby and lounge area were awesome. Rooms were small but comfortable and perfect for a quick trip. Great experience and will be back again.
